name: University of East Anglia
goal:
Established in 1963, the University of East Anglia (UEA) comprises four Faculties (Science, Medicine & Health Sciences, Social Sciences, and Arts & Humanities), and 19 Schools of study. It supports around 11,000 undergraduates and 4,000 postgraduate students.

UEA was ranked as a top 200 university in the Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2019, one of the youngest institutions in that elite. UEA was also ranked 14th in the Complete University Guide 2019 and 15th in the Times and Sunday Times Good University Guide 2019.

In 2012, UEA was named the 10th best university in the world under fifty years old (Times Higher Education 100 Under 50).

The City of Norwich, where UEA is based, has been ranked fourth in the UK for the number of most highly cited scientists after London, Cambridge and Oxford (Thomson Reuters).

A significant proportion of research undertaken here at UEA is now supported by European funding, with a current portfolio of around 41 ‘live’ research projects, with a value of more than €28m.

UEA has been developing a strong track record in European framework projects; in EU Framework Programme 7 (2008-2013) and under Horizon 2020 (2014 onwards), UEA has participated in or coordinated a total of around 75 European Projects.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Banking and financial services, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
Research and Innovation - Horizon 2020 funding
Student and staff mobility, teaching and Training - Erasmus+ funding
Research interests across the full breadth core activities - particularly environmental/climate change, food & health, energy/low carbon, economic/business and family policy
Economic development – ERDF and Interreg funding
Non framework programmes - particularly the LIFE, the 3rd Health, and the Rights, Equality & Citizenship Programmes
